ygData.subject: RE: [rest-discuss] DELETE container?
ygData.msgSnippet: ... In WebDAV, DELETE is always deep . There s no way to delete a collection without it s children, because it would result in a DAV-inconsistent namespace

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Seairth Jacobs [mailto:seairth@...]
> Sent: Wednesday, April 09, 2003 5:47 PM
> To: rest-discuss
> Subject: Fw: [rest-discuss] DELETE container?
>
>
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: "Mark Baker" <mbaker@...>
> To: "Seairth Jacobs" <seairth@...>; "rest-discuss"
> <rest-discuss@yahoogroups.com>
> Sent: Wednesday, April 09, 2003 11:29 AM
> Subject: RE: [rest-discuss] DELETE container?
>
>
> I've found the following heuristics useful; if the life
> of the child is inextricably linked to the life of the
> parent, then kill the child when the parent is killed.
> Otherwise, don't.
>
> In order to kill off independant children, I'd be tempted
> to use DAV's "Depth" feature on a delete to delete the
> childen.  But I've never implemented that.
>
> MB

In WebDAV, DELETE is always "deep". There's no way to delete a collection
without it's children, because it would result in a DAV-inconsistent
namespace

Julian.
